label: Acceleration
short_description: The ability to increase velocity as quickly as possible from a stationary start or slow move.

label: Agility
short_description: The ability to change body position or direction efficiently in response to a stimulus.

label: Balance
short_description: The ability to maintain the line of gravity within the base of support with minimal postural sway.

label: Change of Direction
short_description: The physical ability to change movement direction (pre-planned).

label: Conditioning
short_description: Training to improve the energy systems' ability to perform work and recover.

label: Coordination
short_description: The ability to execute smooth, accurate, and controlled motor responses.

label: Deceleration
short_description: The ability to safely and efficiently reduce speed or come to a controlled stop.

label: Jump Training
short_description: Training focused on increasing vertical or horizontal displacement.

label: Mobility
short_description: The ability of a joint to move actively through a full, intended range of motion.

label: Plyometrics
short_description: Exercises that use the stretch-shortening cycle to increase muscle power.

label: Power
short_description: The ability to exert maximum muscular force in as short a time as possible.

label: Reaction Time
short_description: The interval between stimulus presentation and initiation of muscular response.

label: Speed
short_description: The ability to move the whole body at a high rate of motion over a set distance.

label: Throwing/Rotation
short_description: Training the body to generate and transfer force through the transverse plane.

label: Other
short_description: Any training focus that does not fit into the primary performance categories.
